title: Strict ESM module.id equivalent
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template or we'll close your issue -->

## Feature request

A `module.id` equivalent in the strict ESM world.
We currently have `import.meta.url`, but that is not quite equal to `module.id` as I believe it cannot directly be used to index Webpack's module cache.

Naming up for disscussion - `import.meta.id` or `import.meta.webpackId`?

<!-- Issues that contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->
<!-- Check if this feature needs to be implemented in a plugin or loader instead -->
<!-- If yes: file the issue on the plugin/loader repo -->
<!-- Features related to the development server should be filed on this repo instead -->

**What is the expected behavior?**

This would give the same value as `module.id` does today - but only available in strict ESM runtimes.

**What is motivation or use case for adding/changing the behavior?**

The primary use case for this is to implement recoverable self-accepting HMR behaviour.

In CommonJS, we would do:

```js
if (module.hot) {
  function hotAcceptHandler(err) {
    // or `require.cache` instead of `__webpack_require__.c`
    __webpack_require__.c[module.id].hot.accept(hotAcceptHandler);
  }

  module.hot.accept(hotAcceptHandler);
}
```

In strict ESM, I believe it is currently impossible to do so:

```js
if (import.meta.hot) {
  function hotAcceptHandler(err) {
    // What should be used for `module.id` if `module` is not available?
    __webpack_require__.c[module.id].hot.accept(hotAcceptHandler);
  }

  import.meta.hot.accept(hotAcceptHandler);
}
```

**How should this be implemented in your opinion?**

Re-use current implementation of `module.id`, but also inject the value for `import.meta.webpackId`.

**Are you willing to work on this yourself?**

Yes if this is something that is accepted to be in Webpack.
